key_title: Key to the species of Cotula

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves entire or pinnatifid with a few irregular teeth or lobes
Leaves pinnatisect with lobed segments, or bipinnatisect
Lower leaves oblong, more than 1 mm wide, usually pinnatifid, rarely entire; involucral bracts more than 8, oblong; florets bright yellow; plant perennial
Lower leaves narrow-linear to filiform, to c. 1 mm wide, entire; involucral bracts 5–8, suborbicular; florets pale yellow; plant annual
Plant more or less glabrous; peduncles stout or slender, shorter than or slightly exceeding leaves at anthesis
Plant conspicuously villous; peduncles very slender, greatly exceeding the leaves at anthesis
Leaves rosetted, once pinnatisect; peduncles stout, hollow, shorter than leaves at anthesis; stoloniferous perennial of alps; leaves 1-pinnatisect; alpine areas
Leaves mostly cauline, pinnatisect with pinnatifid segments; peduncles slender, solid, slightly exceeding leaves at anthesis; erect annual of lowland areas
